meanings.definition: The fact or quality of being different, divergent, or inconsistent.
meanings.sent1: The variance in opinions among the group led to a lively discussion.
meanings.sent2: There was a noticeable variance in the colors of the flowers in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The variance in the weather forecast made planning the picnic quite challenging.
meanings.sent4: Her mood showed a wide variance throughout the day, like a rollercoaster.
meanings.sent5: The artist used a high level of color variance in the painting, creating a dynamic effect.

meanings.definition: The state or fact of disagreeing or being at odds.
meanings.sent1: The siblings were in constant variance over who got to choose the TV channel.
meanings.sent2: There was a clear variance between the two political parties on the issue.
meanings.sent3: The variance between the cat and the dog was evident in their playful chase.
meanings.sent4: The variance in opinions created a lively debate at the town hall meeting.
meanings.sent5: The variance in tastes among the group made choosing a restaurant difficult.

meanings.definition: The amount by which something differs or deviates from a standard or expectation.
meanings.sent1: The high variance in test scores indicated a wide range of understanding.
meanings.sent2: The variance in prices at different stores made comparison shopping essential.
meanings.sent3: The variance in the recipe caused the cake to turn out differently than expected.
meanings.sent4: The variance in traffic patterns made the commute unpredictable.
meanings.sent5: The variance in sizes of the shoes made finding the right pair a challenge.
